result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Lamont Haskins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Lamont Haskins in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Charles Lamont Haskins.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Plaisted requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles Lamont Haskins in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Charles Lamont Haskins.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Plaisted has just been appointed and requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Calendar call scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Lamont Haskins in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted as a friend of the court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. Matter set for pretrial conference. Defendant needs to contact public defenders office to have Attorney Plaisted formally appointed. Defendant has an earlier case that is set for jury trial in this court. Attorney Plaisted would like a status with both cases. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/08/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JRP, MR.

Defendant Charles Lamont Haskins in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @1:30p
